attributes.action: The option for farm animal sanctuaries to replace ear tags with microchips
attributes.background: Identification ear tags on farm animals for me and many others are a constant reminder of what certain animals are bred for and where they have come from. I have a farm animal sanctuary and all of our animals will be living the rest of their lives at the sanctuary, so ear tags are not necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
Farm animals that are in a sanctuary environment, that will never be entering the food chain nor being rehomed I don't believe need to have ear tags nor slap marks or tattoos for pigs. 
I believe that ear tags are pointless in a sanctuary, they must be extremely annoying, they can get infected, tags are caught and pulled out. I understand the government want a tractability system in place but microchipping will allow all the information that is needed to be on the microchip.

attributes.action: Abolish Leasehold
attributes.background: Leasehold is a completely outdated law and should be abolished. Freeholders charge exorbitant amount for annual service charge and at the time of lease renewal. It is so inhumane that you spend your hard earned money and still treated as a tenant.

attributes.action: Impose a ban on unnessary plastic packaging being sold in supermarkets
attributes.background:
BP2 has highlighted how plastic is affecting our ecosystems with terrible consequences. 

Supermarkets are guilty of wrapping everything from avocado to apples in plastic which is rarely recyclable. 

Let’s demand that by law, less plastic packaging is used and what is HAS to be recyclable.
attributes.additional_details:
8 million tonnes of plastic is found in our oceans every year and marine life is paying the price.  

Plastic bags have been retrieved from the stomachs of multiple mammals including whales and albatross. Plastic forks have been found lodged in the noses of sea turtles and fish have been found growing around plastic pullrings and wrappers. 

It’s time the UK cleaned up its act and minimised our use of plastic before the damage is irreversible.

attributes.action: Urge football associations to boycott the FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar.
attributes.background: The FIFA World Cup 2022 is to be held in Qatar. In preparing for the tournament, the state of Qatar has committed appalling human rights violations, as exposed by organisations including Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International. The UK's national football teams cannot be allowed to compete.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/09/27/qatar-take-urgent-action-protect-construction-workers

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/campaigns/2016/03/qatar-world-cup-of-shame/

Reports such as these illustrate the scale and shocking nature of human rights abuses sponsored by FIFA in Qatar. It would make a mockery of the UK's commitment to human rights and international law to turn a blind eye to such flagrant violations. It is time to say enough is enough: football and profits cannot trump humanity.

attributes.action: Raise Minimum Wage for Night Shift Workers.
attributes.background: Night shifts workers are regularly paid a premium on top of a companies normal wage but for many this is not the case. Since the introduction of the NMW (which was a good thing in general, though it does require some revisions) many night shift workers are now paid the national minimum wage.
attributes.additional_details: I propose that workers who work between the hours of midnight and six o'clock in the morning are paid a mandatory extra £2 per hour above the current national minimum wage.

attributes.action: Change the law on selling houses in the UK, in favour of protecting the vendors.
attributes.background:
Protect vendors from incomplete sales & costs being incurred. 
Although close to my heart, I am confident this is a UK wide issue & I propose we
introduce deposits, or purchasers accountability/liability, to protect & pay (for example) vendor solicitor fees. 
Make house selling/buying achievable.
attributes.additional_details:
Twice our house sale has fallen through and fees have been incurred due to the buyers ‘change of circumstance’. In these instances or similar, such fees should not be the responsibility of the vendor.

When you wish to buy a house, you should be committed to buying that house and as such (and similar to other countries) deposits should be paid. Additionally, any vendor solicitor fees (or any other costs) where buyers renage on their decision, should be solely the purchasers accountability.

attributes.action: Stop child maintenance payments being calculated before tax, calculate after!
attributes.background: We currently calculate child maintenance on the paying parents income before tax based in income they do not have but rather 20-40% less. Many parents are left unable to live and go to lengths such as suicide. Yes pay for your child but it has to be fair. Also children within their home suffer too.
attributes.additional_details:
Calculations are based off of money you don't have ie you have a gross income of £3300 per month (which cms will use to calculate) however you're actually getting £2600 net income. A huge £700 difference. 
A child you pay for is worth £300 a month yet the children in your own home are work £10 a month each!
People have committed suicide due to cms calculations and pushing them.

attributes.action: Place limits on the amount of carbon that polluters are allowed to emit
attributes.background: Help reduce the amount of carbon being released into the atmosphere to aid the prevention of global warming

attributes.action: Change the law to make it compulsory for all taxis to be fitted with CCTV
attributes.background: Shops, bars, hospitals, and the majority of public places are fitted with CCTV to maintain public safety.  Introducing cameras into taxis would promote the safety of both the general public and the driver, and decrease the risk of assault, abuse and theft.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics from the Metropolitan Police Service have revealed 126 taxi or private hire drivers were charged with violent or sexual offences in 2015. Furthermore 6 separate councils in the North West of England have granted or renewed permits for more than 300 convicted drivers since 2012. Within these approvals are those committed of sexual offences, indecent exposure, drug dealing, violence and harassment, possession of a fire arm, theft, burglary and criminal damage. This figures show that there needs to be further restrictions, and increased monitoring in place. 
 
The privacy of both parties would still be maintained, as conversations would not be recorded, and devices could be deactivated when the driver is not working.

attributes.action: Introduce a 5p tax on all disposable takeaway cups.
attributes.background: The UK uses approximately 2.5 billion takeaway cups a year. Most are un-recyclable. This is a huge amount of waste. The 5p bag tax reduced carrier bag use by 85%, from 7 billion to 500 million a year. Introducing a similar tax for disposable cups would reduce another source of waste.

attributes.action: Make The PSA Test for Prostrate Cancer compulsory for men over 40.
attributes.background:
Prostrate cancer is a treatable disease, like most the earlier the better.
There is a simple test that can indicate whether someone is at risk but it is not freely offered unless recommended by a GP.
This should be given the same level of awareness as Breast Cancer is for women but it is not.
attributes.additional_details:
The chances of being affected by prostrate cancer increases with age, but can affect men who are 40+.
Men don't talk about their problems, so we can continue boldly on fearing the worst because of the rectal examination when in fact men do not know that The PSA Test is available through a simple blood test.
This should be a part of the blood test - it would remove the need for repeat appointments with The NHS and therefore actually save both time and money in catching this before its too late.

attributes.action: Make Armistice Day a national holiday starting 2018, 100 years since end of WW1.
attributes.background: Previous petitions have failed, but lets not give up.  The great war needs to live on in the hearts and minds of the next and all coming generations.  Additionally, there is no bank holiday between August and Christmas, and many workers feel the need for a break during this time.

attributes.action: childminders paid direct by the government for childcare element
attributes.background: Childminders are very important as they allow parents to go to work, the government pays the parents a percentage of the childcare costs, however childminders loose every month as parents use the money and don't pay our bills, we are left chasing parents for money that we have worked for
attributes.additional_details:
Childminders have a very demanding job, some of us work well over 60 hours a week as there is lots of paper work and planning to be done.  We are left with outstanding bill that parents don't pay and our own bills cant be paid as our wages are not paid by the parents
this is why they government should pay us directly instead of the money going to the parent

attributes.action: Combine the digital tachograph with the driver CPC (DQC) card
attributes.background: Currently you need a 5yr digital tachograph card to record your actions and the driver CPC card to prove you have completed 35h training over 5 years if you don't have your CPC card you will be fined £50.00 if you are driving commercial vehicles you need to have both with you a legal requirement
attributes.additional_details: Having trained hundreds of drivers and spoken to hundreds of transport managers everyone agrees there should be an alignment of both cards you need both to work and a simple alignment so you cannot get a digital card without completing 35h training

attributes.action: Tackle corporate tax-dodging – Make the UK a participant in CCCTB
attributes.background: Tax-dodging by companies like Apple and Google is a huge problem in the UK. The proposal for a 'Common Consolidated Corporate Tax Base' (CCCTB) by the European Commission would change the rules to stop this. Whatever our views on EU membership, this needs to be included in the final Brexit deal.
attributes.additional_details: As an example of the current system, Apple in 2014 paid just £12 million in UK tax on UK profits of £2 billion. To do this, 'Apple UK' pays its profits to 'Apple Ireland', where it can pay less than 4% corporate tax. CCCTB would change tax rules so that companies be charged based on where their activity be done – meaning that a company with sales, employment and assets (say, 20% of its European total) in the UK would have to pay UK tax on 20% of its European profits; a far fairer system.

attributes.action: Make the use of inhumane cat deterrents a criminal offence
attributes.background: As a cat owner, I was shocked when my neighbour placed a row of over thirty rusty, three inch nails along the fence dividing our gardens. I rang the police, the council and the housing association to be told there was nothing i could do as he owns the fence. Both households have children and pets.
attributes.additional_details: Any sort of spikes or jagged projections including any made aggressive topping or addition to a wall or fence including carpet gripper, broken glass and nails that are a danger to humans or animals should be illegal. We should not have to live in fear of our family members (Including pets) being harmed in our own homes. Currently it is only an offence if the fence is on land adjoining a public highway, not a home.

attributes.action: Ban energy drinks
attributes.background: My brother died August 2017 at the age of 25. We’re convinced this was due to drinking an excessive amount of energy drinks a day (up to 15). This increased his state of depression leading him to commit suicide. People should be aware of the risks these drinks can have, especially on young lives.
attributes.additional_details: Too much caffeine will keep you awake causing sleep deprivation. Caffeine has the ability to raise a person's blood pressure, energy drinks can contain up to 31mg of caffeine. Niacin is one of the main ingredients in Energy Drinks. Although it has its benefits, niacin can cause dizziness, and rapid heart rate. This cannot be good for anybody.

attributes.action: Allow recovery agents to have a different colour beacons while working
attributes.background: I believe recovery operatives should be allowed to have a different colour beacon on their vehicles and also be allowed to use flashing red/white lights on the rear of vehicle
attributes.additional_details: Due to there being no restrictions on who can use Orange beacons people no longer take notice of them, we are in effect an emergency service working in one of the most dangerous locations. We should be respected and allowed the same safety of any emergency service who works in a high risk location.

attributes.action: UK Government make it compulsory for manufacturers of salt in UK to add iodine.
attributes.background: Iodine deficiency is linked to miscarriage,stillbirth,mental impairment,increase of perinatal and infant mortality. It is the most common worldwide cause of thyroid disorders. Low iodine can cause hypothyroidism,goitre and can affect fertility,pregnancy and neurodevelopmental disorders in new-borns
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Mark Vanderpump, told the Society for Endocrinology 'Data suggests the UK is iodine deficient’ A study involving 700 teenage girls at nine UK centres found more than two thirds had an iodine deficiency and nearly a fifth showed very low iodine levels.
http://astutehealthcare.co.uk/iodine-aqua/pdf/2011-bbcnews-Worrying-levels-of-iodine-deficiency-in-the-uk.pdf
http://www.who.int/nutrition/topics/idd/en/
http://www.ukiodine.org/professor-john-lazarus/
http://theiodineproject.m.webs.com/

attributes.action: Make cyclists display number plates. They are road users as well.
attributes.background: Cyclists seem to think they are above the law. They should be registered and display a number plate so they can be identified.
attributes.additional_details: I have constantly witnessed them ignoring red lights and not giving way at junctions. If they were to be the cause of and accident they can ride away without being identified.

attributes.action: Ban the production and use of plastic rings as packaging material
attributes.background: Plastic rings are currently being used to hold drinking cans together. Animals are getting caught up in the plastic rings and need to either live handicapped with them or die dreadfully. Single cans can be put into shopping bags. There is no need to harm animals and the environment.

attributes.action: Improve mental health education in schools & make offering counselling required
attributes.background: The teaching of mental health becoming required was a huge step, but there’s a long way to go until support and info on mental health within schools is enough. Having anxiety and depression myself, I know that many people can be left alone or confused; it shouldn’t be seen as a minor topic to rush.
attributes.additional_details:
Counselling in schools should be offered and easy to access, eg if students were provided with questionnaires on their mental well-being once every few months, their mental state could be easily monitored and be offered support and extra info if needed.
- Around 850,000 5-16 yr olds suffer with mental illness (almost 1 in 10 / 3 per class)
-70% increase in self harm rates in 10-14 yr olds over past 2 years
-70% of young people with a mental illness don't get the appropriate support

attributes.action: Theresa May. NO bridge or new infrastructure to be built between UK and France
attributes.background: We sadly have the channel tunnel which people can still walk through. We the public do not want anymore tax payers money being spent on infrastructure, that joins us to france.We're an island and want to keep it that way for OUR safety.
attributes.additional_details: Boris Johnson on Thursday January 18th 2018 said he wants to now build a bridge to join the uk to france

attributes.action: Ban unsafe sleep products such as bumpers, sleep positioners and pillows
attributes.background: I lost a child due to SIDS and now want to spread awareness about the importance of safe sleep. New “sleep” products are hitting the market and new parents are fooled by their false claims. Using these products (sleep positioners, pillows, bumpers) can increase the risk of suffocation.
attributes.additional_details: There is sufficient evidence that babies have died as a consequence of using these products. They shouldn’t be allowed to be sold in the UK. There has been 2 infant deaths related to baby hammocks yet they are still sold. There have been cot bumper related deaths and they are banned in certain states in America . New studies show sleep positioners to be unsafe. Baby pods and nests should carry a warning that they are not safe for overnight sleep.

attributes.action: The breeding of puppies and kittens for profit by unlicensed breeders be banned.
attributes.background: Kelly's Kat Rescue has taken in over 150 cats and kittens in their small town and the surrounding areas since March all needing vet treatment and some in a life threatening condition. We need to prevent this from happening so we are calling for a licence to breed kittens and puppies.

attributes.action: Make 5th March a national holiday in celebration of Mark E Smith (born 05/03/57)
attributes.background: Mark Edward Smith was a prolific and talented writer & performer in The Fall. Over 40 years he was the creative force behind the most original music/lyrics, documented in some 30+ studio albums, various Ep's, 66 singles & countless live, bootleg & complication albums.
attributes.additional_details: Best British writer ever. (Better than Shakespeare)

attributes.action: Ban the culinary practice of boiling lobsters while still alive and conscious.
attributes.background:
The Swiss government is banning the culinary practice of boiling lobsters while they are still conscious.

This is in response to studies that suggest lobsters have advanced nervous systems and feel pain.

Lobsters can live for up to 50 years and the practice of boiling them alive is barbaric.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pain_in_crustaceans

"Opinion on the aspects of the biology and welfare of animals used for experimental and other scientific purposes". The EFSA Journal. European Food Safety Authority. 292: 1–46. 2005.

https://onekindplanet.org/uploads/publications/cephalopods-decapod-crustaceans.pdf

attributes.action: Fund bus passes for 16 to 18 years olds who are still in full time education
attributes.background: Why does the government insists that our children stay in education until they are 18 but will not fund the transportation to get to sixth form or college after they leave school at 16.

attributes.action: Ban the removal of non farmed fresh water course fish for use as food.
attributes.background: Fresh water fish are now on the decline due a number of reasons from Cormarants, Otters and people from Cultures where removal and eating of course fish is acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
As a lifelong angler along with many other friends we have noticed many rivers,ponds lakes ect around Lincolnshire and Yorkshire have started to see a large decline in fish populations.
To counteract and help towards this we aim to start this petition to stop humans taking course fish from any waters unless specifically bred for the table for the period of 10 years with then a revue on the progress.
We feel this gives fish stocks a slightly better chance to help halt the decline in many venues.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for school toilets to have no soap, toilet paper, or locks
attributes.background: Currently I don’t believe it is illegal for schools to have insufficient hygiene standards in toilets. Many students avoid using toilets during school which can cause further health complications including kidney infections. This also encourages smoking, bullying, and vandalism.

attributes.action: All children aged 16 to 19 in further education should be entitled to EMA
attributes.background: I am a mother to 4 children. Not all my children are entitled to EMA because we earn too much. Why should our children be penalised by the Government when EMA is for the child and not the parent? It unfair for all children in further education.
attributes.additional_details: Without EMA children like mine don’t have the money to do what their peers do. I have also spoken to other parents who feel the same way as I do and feel that our children are being penalised by the government.

attributes.action: Reject any proposals to merge Christchurch with Bournemouth and Poole council
attributes.background: 84% of Christchurch already voted AGAINST the merge with Bournemouth and Poole in the recent postal vote.
attributes.additional_details:
negociations are still happening on weather to ignore the voters and merge anyway... Christchurch is my home town, and we voted, so our vote and our voices matter. if our vote is ignored then why even vote in the first place? 
The people of Christchurch have decided that we do NOT want to be merged with Bournemouth and Poole so sign this petition if you would like the Government and Parliament to reject any proposals that the councils be merged. Thank you.

attributes.action: Scrap the charges for child arrangement applications
attributes.background:
Where a resident parent agitates or denies contact between non resident parents and their children, the process for an arrangement order demands the non resident parent pay costs of £215 after also having to pay for attempts at mediation.
The right to a family life should not be priced in this way.

attributes.action: Introduce a reassuring EM radiation limit for homes and schools (eg 1,000 µW/m2)
attributes.background:
There is no specific limit for mobile phone radiation in homes. We use the out-dated 1998 ICNIRP recommendation for incidental public exposure, which includes no risk management. 

Badly sited masts result in unnecessarily high levels which are never turned off and the health impact is unknown.
attributes.additional_details:
The World Health Organisation continues to rate this type of radiation as a Class 2b Carcinogen and many studies link it to childhood lukemia and other illnesses. Sufferers of electrosensitivity are also becoming increasingly common.

A phone network continues to work at 0.000002µW/m2 (source: powerwatch.org.uk). Before it stopped auditing it, over 10 years ago, the highest level Ofcom recorded inside a residence was 790µW/m2. Other countries have sensible limits without affecting reception.

attributes.action: Allow all children in school term times a leave allowance for family hoildays.
attributes.background:
I am unable to take leave in term times due to the loss of earnings being self employed and the inflated prices travel operators charge. This makes it impossible for normal working people to afford a family holiday. 
We ask for the government to discuss allowing at least 7 days a year for this.
attributes.additional_details: It is a known fact that during our childrens term times average holiday's increase by hundreds if not thousands. This has been an ongoing issue that the government have never really addressed to benefit parents. The impact on working class and self employed often means we are unable to have family hoilday's due to the inflated prices. Enabling a small amount of leave days per year, will benefit all children from a family point of view as well as a educational point of view. Thank you.

attributes.action: Allow all the proceeds of ‘right to buy’ sales to be kept by the local authority
attributes.background: When right to buy council houses are sold there is no benefit to the local authority. If all proceeds of a right to buy sale were kept by the local authority the business case for new council housing is strong. Councils would build, the homeless would be housed, and funds earned for local councils.
attributes.additional_details:
When right to buy council houses are sold only a fraction of the price ever went to the local authority. This put an end to the building of new council housing. There is a clear local authority business case for building council housing: income generated will more than cover the costs, increasing revenues and reducing the need for cuts in other services. But the high chance that the tenant buys and all revenues go to central government destroys the business case.
See https://philhemsley.wordpress.com/2018/01/06/the-simple-change-to-government-budgeting-rules-that-could-solve-the-housing-problem/

attributes.action: Training for all teachers and doctors to identify autism in males and females
attributes.background: Austism presents differently in males and females that most girls get left undignosed and left flying under the radar, a failed generation and we need to change this. All doctors and teachers everywhere should have the training to recognise autism in both sexes.
attributes.additional_details: We need to stop letting these children/family struggle because no one really knows what we go through, especially if you are an autistic female who can mask her traits by observing and mimicking what other children do and giving eye contact when it comes to comunicating but this is very exausting to the autistic female, which results in meltdowns as soon as she gets home from holding herself together all day and being someone she's not, just because we are female we are thought not to have autism.

attributes.action: Increase the amount of support given to sexual assault and rape victims.
attributes.background: 85000 women and 12000 men are raped every year, that is 11 every hour. 13% of women who are raped attempt suicide and 94% experience post- traumatic stress disorder within two weeks of the incident. I believe that all victims should be provided with support to guide them to living with the trauma.
attributes.additional_details: Misconceptions about false reporting have direct, negative consequences and may contribute to why many victims do not report it. I believe people should be better educated about the issues and people need to know about what they can do to help. Rapes do not always occur between strangers in dark alleys, 85 to 90 percent of victims know their attacker; this only makes it harder for victims to move on from the incident.

attributes.action: Introduce a charge for all foreign vehicles using roads in the UK.
attributes.background: Currently foreign registered vehicles pay no charges driving in the UK, unlike European countries where an equivalent tax is subsidised by toll road networks. This is unfair to UK motorists & operators. Instigating a familiar system (vignette) at point of UK entry, collection would be easy & cheap.
attributes.additional_details: Many foreign drivers avoid payment at tolls, such as Dartford Crossing (Kent), where lost revenue runs at £42,000,000  in cancelled penalty notices alone. Prosecutions for excess speed, failure to stop/report accidents etc. would improve as drivers/owners are held to account utilising data collected. UK Insurance customers would see a dividend as foreign registered vehicles in the UK seek registration, tax & insurance in accordance with UK legislation, improvinvg safety, and the environment.

attributes.action: Make pet owners responsibility for their pet’s microchip details when rehoming
attributes.background: If an owner has to rehome their dog or cat it should be partly their responsibility to notify their microchip provider that the pet has been rehomed and send them the new owners details. Similar to V5 for a car where both the new and old owners have to notify the DVLA. If not a fine can be issued
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be better laws in place to make it the responsibility of BOTH the old and new owners to update the animals microchip details.
Based on figures from the Dogs Trust Up to 12 dogs a day face being Put to Sleep because their owners haven’t updated their dogs microchip details 
And a further study conducted by Dogs Trust has found a mere 9% of dog owners consider updating their dogs’ microchips post-move a priority, with sorting digital TV coming above this.

attributes.action: Convert the EU Charter of Rights into UK law
attributes.background: The Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union is important to everybody. It gives people a voice to be heard. The Charter of Rights needs to be converted into UK law after leaving EU so that our rights as humans are fully protected both at home and abroad.
attributes.additional_details: EU Charter of Rights gives access to proper justice and proper freedom for all without partiality. The UK has had a good history on human rights and protection for its citizens both at home and abroad.

attributes.action: Make it law for all companies to plant three trees for every one they cut down.
attributes.background: Deforestation is happening at an unsustainable rate. Not only is it putting the survival of millions of species at risk but is also accelerating the effects of global warming. The best way to combat this is for every company trading in the UK to plant at least three trees for every one it cuts down.
attributes.additional_details:
"Many of the world’s most threatened and endangered animals live in forests, and 1.6 billion people rely on benefits forests offer, including food, fresh water, clothing, traditional medicine and shelter." "Some 46-58 thousand square miles of forest are lost each year—equivalent to 48 football fields every minute." https://www.worldwildlife.org/threats/deforestation#
"Deforestation is responsible for nearly 20 per cent of global carbon emissions." https://www.forestry.gov.uk/forestry/infd-7m8mnm

attributes.action: Ban all plastic shopping bags and instead only sell reusable shopping bags.
attributes.background: The impact of plastic bags on the environment is enormous. ... Approximately 100,000 sea turtles and other marine animals die every year because they either mistake the bags for food or get strangled in them, says Natural.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/nov/03/dramatic-rise-in-plastic-seabed-litter-around-uk
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/greenerideal.com/news/environment/0613-how-do-plastic-bags-affect-our-environment/amp/

attributes.action: To change the law, to regulate maintenance charges for leasehold properties.
attributes.background: Each of the 5 flats in my property are charged £1800 annually. Each segment of this bill is extortionate charges for which you can get alot cheaper. Now we have just found out that we need to raise £13,000 in 2 years for the roof.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK abolishing the Monarchy and becoming a Republic
attributes.background: A Monarchy that receives taxpayers' money is an anachronism in a modern democracy. A referendum should be held to ascertain whether the British people are prepared to continue to pay for this archaic institution.

attributes.action: Revoke Ban on Waste Drying Subsidy, impacting on recycling Waste Plastics Crisis
attributes.background: Government plans to remove 'wood fuel drying' and RDF waste (Refused Derived fuel) as an eligible heat use which will impact on legitimate resolution to UK plastic waste crisis.  Whilst the EA enforcing a ban on mixed waste wood drives the price of virgin woodchip, increasing price in line with OIL.
attributes.additional_details:
What will happen to Plastics now? Landfill, polluting oceans? Plastics came from natural gas/oil & burn hotter than wood/coal - turn this valuable resource into Local Energy. 
EU generates electricity from Plastics, Netherlands boasts 90% recycling. Why can’t UK can do the same? 
https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/the-non-domestic-renewable-heat-incentive-further-proposed-amendments
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/classifying-waste-wood-from-mixed-waste-wood-sources-rps-207/

attributes.action: Return power over admissions to academy schools to local authorities
attributes.background: Currently UK academy schools are not bound by local authorities’ admissions decisions. They are regulated by the Education and Skills Funding Agency, which is slow to respond to local authorities’ issues with academy schools.
attributes.additional_details: We’d like to see changes to the rules of legislation requiring academy schools to be bound to local education authorities and not be able to ignore rules they do not want to adhere to. We’d also like all public schools admissions authorities decisions to admit a child to a school to be final and binding. Academy schools are only bound by decisions made solely by the Secretary of State for Education. This is a situation that allows schools to completely ignore local schools authorities and this must change.

attributes.action: Provide certificates for stillborn babies born before 24 weeks
attributes.background: Many parents who suffered a loss of a baby under 24 weeks gestation believe their baby and their loss is being clearly ignored like the baby never existed. It would help the parent if they were offered certificates acknowledging their Baby.
attributes.additional_details: According to the Identity and Passport office, while there is no requirement to register stillbirths before 24 weeks, many hospitals offer parents a certificate which recognises the loss of a baby. Such informal certificates enable individuals preferences to be met. The Government should make offering these certificates to all parents a legal requirement.

attributes.action: Free dental care for UK University Students whilst in full-time education
attributes.background: UK University students over the age of 19 currently have to pay for dental care. This is very expensive and students already have the burden of paying for rent, food, college material and travel. Paying an excessive amount for dental care is off-putting and deprives some from getting essential care.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of eggs from caged chickens
attributes.background: Keeping caged chickens is wrong as chickens are living animals and deserve to be treated fairly. As many trusted sources have confirmed, it is extremely bad for them - they can become overweight and ill and lead unhappy lives.
attributes.additional_details:
As Cambridge University has proven, keeping hens in cages results in a “higher incidence of metabolic disorders”, which means that the chickens are under severe risk of SDS (Sudden Death Syndrome). This disease costs the US alone 100 million dollars annually – surely you don't want to allow this to continue in the UK too?

Letting caged hens have their own space is critical, and if we don't act fast we will be condoning cruelty.
